The steps are extracted based on the sequence of actions described by Jacques Pepin, starting with the preparation of the shellfish and ending with the sauce preparation.
dish_description: The dish being prepared is a serving of fresh clams and oysters accompanied by classic horseradish sauce and mignonette sauce.

cooking_steps.description: Place clams and oysters in the freezer for 10 to 15 minutes to shock them, making them easier to open.

Start opening the clams by using a small knife or a clam opener, inserting it against the opening, and twisting to pry the shell open slightly. Do not fully open them if you have multiple clams; just create the initial opening.
For tougher clams, use a towel to protect your hands and apply pressure at the hinge to break it open.
When ready to fully open and serve, use a small spoon to detach the clam from the shell, ensuring it is loose and clean.
For oysters, use a sturdy oyster knife and a towel for grip. Insert the knife into the hinge at the back of the oyster, apply pressure, and twist to pop it open.
Slide the knife or a small spoon along the top shell to cut the muscle and fully open the oyster. Repeat for the bottom shell to detach the oyster completely.
Prepare the classic horseradish sauce by combining ketchup, hot sauce, lemon juice or mild vinegar, and horseradish in a bowl.
Make the mignonette sauce by cracking black pepper, finely chopping shallots and chives, adding a dash of salt, and filling the mixture with red wine vinegar.
